actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Roll Call 353
actions-list.actionItem: Yea and Nay vote pending.

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1344 — "Finding that Merrick Garland, Attorney General of the United States, is in contempt of the House of Representatives for disobeying a certain subpoena."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 352).
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 351).
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Espaillat moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8772.
On agreeing to the Jackson (TX) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 350).
On agreeing to the Self amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 349).
On agreeing to the Huizenga amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 348).

At the conclusion of debate on the Jackson (TX) amendment No. 4, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mr. Jackson (TX) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1341, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jackson (TX) amendment No. 4.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Jackson (TX),  numbered 4 printed in House Report 118-578 to reduce funding for the Office of the Attending Physician to the Congress to FY20 levels.

At the conclusion of debate on the Self amendment No. 3, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Valadao demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1341, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Self amendment No. 3.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Self,  numbered 3 printed in House Report 118-578 to prohibit funds for the charging of electric vehicles on Capitol property.
On agreeing to the Self amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1341, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Self amendment No. 2.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Self,  numbered 2 printed in House Report 118-578 to prohibit funds from being used to impose a COVID-19 mask mandate.

At the conclusion of debate on the Huizenga amendment No. 1, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mr. Huizenga demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1341, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Huizenga amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Huizenga,  numbered 1 printed in House Report 118-578 to prohibit funds being made available by this Act to the Congressional Office of International Leadership.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 8772.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Nick LaLota to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1341 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8281, H.J. Res. 165, H.R. 8772, H.R. 7637 and H.R. 7700 The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8772 under a structured rule and H.R. 8281, H.J. Res. 165, H.R. 7700, and H.R. 7637 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1341. H.R. 8772 — "Making appropriations for the Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Garcia of IL to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rabbi Mendy Deitsch, Chabad of the East Valley, Chandler, Arizona.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
